node.title: Police searching for missing central Otago man Wayne Hammond appeal for dashcam footage
node.description: Hammond's work vehicle was found in the car park underneath the Clyde Bridge, but he remains missing.
node.content: ["Police searching for missing central Otago man Wayne Hammond are making another appeal to the public for dashcam footage.", "Hammond was last seen leaving his Henderson Drive home address around 7:30am on Monday November 1 in his work vehicle, a 1999 white/silver Mitsubishi Challenger 4WD with 'RockGas' on the side.", "His vehicle was found in the car park underneath the Clyde Bridge, at the start of the Clyde-Alexandra track, at about 3pm on Monday afternoon. Search and rescue teams have been looking around the river track area but haven't found anything of interest.", "Police are appealing for anyone with dashcam footage on that Monday morning to get in touch.", "\"Specifically, we are seeking footage from 7am onwards on November 1 on the Alexandra-Clyde Road and surrounds, specifically Earnscleugh Road,\" a police spokesperson says.", "\"A re-enactment of the drive Wayne took from his home address to the Clyde Bridge car park was done on Monday, and this has generated some further lines of inquiry which police are exploring.\"", "Anyone who can help is asked to please contact police via 105 and quote event number P048471135.\u00a0\u00a0"]
